metadata.title: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) and Pregnancy: What obstetricians need to know
metadata.journal: American Journal of Obstetrics and Gynecology
metadata.abstract: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an emerging disease with a rapid increase in cases and deaths since its first identification in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. Limited data are available about COVID-19 during pregnancy; however, information on illnesses associated with other highly pathogenic coronaviruses (i.e., severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS)) might provide insights into COVID-19’s effects during pregnancy.
metadata.author: Sonja A. Rasmussen, John C. Smulian, John A. Lednicky, Tony S. Wen, Denise J. Jamieson

introduction: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an emerging disease with a rapid increase in cases and deaths since its first identification in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. Limited data are available about COVID-19 during pregnancy; however, information on illnesses associated with other highly pathogenic coronaviruses (i.e., severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS)) might provide insights into COVID-19’s effects during pregnancy.
MERS pregnancy fetus newborn pneumonia preterm birth maternal death fetal death vertical transmission perinatal infection sepsis

Abstract: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an emerging disease with a rapid increase in cases and deaths since its first identification in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. Limited data are available about COVID-19 during pregnancy; however, information on illnesses associated with other highly pathogenic coronaviruses (i.e., severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS)) might provide insights into COVID-19’s effects during pregnancy.
Glossary of terms: Basic Reproduction Number: estimate of number of individuals who will become infected from a single person in a population where all individuals are susceptible
